snippet: Chadian officials suspect that the attacks, which also wounded more than 50 people, were carried out by members of the Boko Haram extremist group from neighboring Nigeria.
abstract: Chadian authorities blame Boko Haram for series of five suicide attacks in Baga Sola, near Lake Chad and Nigerian border; officials report 36 dead and about 50 more wounded in attacks carried out by two women, two children and one man.
lead_paragraph: Chadian officials suspect that the attacks, which also wounded more than 50 people, were carried out by members of the Boko Haram extremist group from neighboring Nigeria.

headline.main: Suicide Bombers Kill at Least 38 at Market and Refugee Camp in Chad
headline.print_headline: Bombers Kill at Least 36 People in Village Housing Refugees in Chad
